raw_data.vendor_name: PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY SERVICES, INC
raw_data.title: Instructional Designer (Educational Support Services)
raw_data.description: • Supports personnel and services for educational needs, including training.  Develop course objectives and samples of behavior or modify existing ones according to Blooms Taxonomy in the cognitive domain and/or Krathwohl’s Taxonomy in the affective domain and provide them to the government for approval prior to the execution of instructions. • Update existing materials or create new courses or modules according to generally accepted instructional design principles (i.e., Blooms cognitive and Krathwohl’s affective domains) prior to implementation. • Create and enhance training curriculum assigned and execute course development project plans following a project plan delivery approach for design and development work. Plan, execute, and measure work results IAW any pre-established suspense. • All materials must meet Section 508 compliance for “reasonable accommodations” and be approved by the government prior to implementation. • Design and develop assigned curricula for management approval as well as the implementation and maintenance of approved courses. Coordinates/works closely with the subject matter experts, and other identified members of staff to develop instructional content and supporting materials for new course development, course maintenance and/or course revisions, and update and input course content for population into learning management system (LMS). • Create (or modify) and deliver (within the suspense time requested) Student Manuals (e.g., LMS, SMS, Adobe Connect) and/or instruction guides as required. • Maintain currency of existing assigned courses IAW pre-established suspense. Upon approval from management, implement changes to course material based on feedback from the functional manager, faculty and students. Utilize appropriate resources i.e., OPM, Air Force Portal, AFPC RSS feeds, functional/student feedback, and similar tools to keep assigned courses current. • Develops media as requested using a variety of tools (e.g. videos, apps and podcast) from course material for use in assigned courses that demonstrate specific skills students are required to learn per the curriculum. • Create (or modify) and deliver to management (within the suspense time requested), “How to Guides” (e.g., Continuity Guides) as require

raw_data.vendor_name: PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY SERVICES, INC
raw_data.title: Course Support Coordinator (Educational Support Services)
raw_data.description: • Supports personnel and services for educational needs, including training. • Prepare all required/mandatory documents for all identified actions prior to, during and after course completion (both for in-resident and on-line) from pre-student registration to managing student accounts to student registration through student graduation, in multiple systems such as the Air University (AU) Portal, LMS, Student Management System (SMS) e.g., iGecko (e.g. creating, copying, building courses and/or accounts, enrolling/dis-enrolling students etc). • Manage all assigned courses (both in-resident and on-line) in the LMS, e.g. creating, copying course material, answering student calls/e-mails and managing day to day issues that arise, submitting trouble tickets when necessary and following up until problem resolution, etc. • Coordinate with appropriate AU offices to add, update, and/or modify assigned courses in the LMS, SMS, and/or AU Portal. Notify appropriate personnel of actions and status of all identified issues and/or concerns. • Assist with coordination to other agencies (e.g. Air Force Material Command (AFMC)) to provide any updates and/or add new assigned courses systems of record (e.g. Education & Training Management Systems (ETMS)). • Assist students/customers with AU Portal and SMS accounts (e.g. registration, deregistration, graduation etc.). • Assist with providing monthly statistics covering e.g., enrollments, drops, and graduations by each course to the senior management. Complete all actions to close out courses per guidance e.g., NLT seven (7) duty days after the end of course. • Serve as initial focal point for all student questions before, during, and after all assigned classes (both in-resident and on-line). • Electronically welcome students to the assigned course(s) and list any course requirements, course status, management notes, etc.

raw_data.vendor_name: PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY SERVICES, INC
raw_data.title: Instructor (Educational Support Services)
raw_data.description: • Supports personnel and services for educational needs, including training. • Develop course objectives and samples of behavior or modify existing ones according to Blooms Taxonomy in the cognitive domain and/or Krathwohl’s Taxonomy in the affective domain and provide them to the government for approval prior to the execution of instructions. • Develop instruction curriculum and conduct Basic Mediation Course (in-resident course) instructor(s) for up to eight (2) classes annually. Each instance of said “course” will last one (1) week (up to 40 contact hours) and consist of approximately 40 students annually. • Develop instruction curriculum and conduct Advanced Mediation Course (in-resident course) instructor(s) for up to one (2) class annually. Each instance of said “course” will last one (1) week (up to 40 contact hours) and consist of approximately 25 students annually. • Develop instruction curriculum and conduct New Employee Orientation (NEO) Instructor/Design for the NEO Course. This course is an asynchronous on-line e-learning course. • Contractor can develop instruction/curriculum internal to their staff needs based upon student feedback as part of their faculty development during duty hours as authorized by the management. • Develop and maintain a Faculty Folder on every instructor according to organizational policy. • Schedule faculty evaluations once a year. • Provide the management an annual written review of Faculty Folders and make available for spot checks as requested. • Attendance for any Government sponsored training must be approved by the Contracting Officer's Representative (COR) and the Contracting Officer (CO).

raw_data.vendor_name: PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY SERVICES, INC
raw_data.title: Project Manager
raw_data.description: Manages cost, schedule, performance and resources for the project. Organizes, directs, and coordinates the planning and production of all activities associated with assigned project. Performs day-to-day management of project tasks and assigned team of software developers and other information system and management professionals. Directs and coordinates all project/program activities where major milestones and project performance decisions are involved. Reports project status to contractor management and AF PMO and other relevant parties. Interfaces with customer representatives on managerial and technical matters. Identifies, reports and manages project risks, action items and alternative solutions to technical issues. Coordinates work efforts for analyzing, designing, integrating, testing, documenting, converting, extending, and implementing information systems. Develops corrective action plans and keeps management, both contractor and PMO, informed.

raw_data.vendor_name: PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY SERVICES, INC
raw_data.title: SAP Business Object SME
raw_data.description: Architecting solutions, reference architecture implementations utilizing SAP technologies, product/tool selection, mentoring, and technical leadership. Responsibilities include technical leadership, infrastructure and implementation architecture of SAP Business Objects with LDAP integration.

raw_data.vendor_name: PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY SERVICES, INC
raw_data.title: Database Administrator
raw_data.description: Knowledgeable in Windows Server 2008R - 2016; SQL Server 2008R - 2014; Oracle 11g or higher RDBMS experience; and BMC Remedy Action Request System v7x platform. Implements, maintains, and designs databases in support of the development and installation of new systems and enhancements to existing systems, Performs system administration and system management functions for database systems.

raw_data.vendor_name: PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY SERVICES, INC
raw_data.title: System Engineer
raw_data.description: Analyzes user’s requirements, concept of operations documents, and high level system architectures to develop system requirements specifications. Analyzes system requirements and leads design and development activities. Guides users in formulating requirements, advises alternative approaches, and conducts feasibility studies. Provides technical leadership for the integration of requirements, design, and technology. Incorporates new plans, designs and systems into ongoing operations. Develops technical documentation. Develops system Architecture and system design documentation. Guides system development and implementation planning through assessment or preparation of system engineering management plans and system integration and test plans. Interacts with the Product Owner regarding Systems Engineering technical considerations and for associated problems, issues or conflicts. Ultimate responsibility for the technical integrity of work performed and deliverables associated with the Systems Engineering area of responsibility.

raw_data.vendor_name: PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY SERVICES, INC
raw_data.title: Web/Application Developer
raw_data.description: Knowledge of and in development of software using Web APIs (Application Programming Interfaces), LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol) Active Directory, Java (JRE and JDK, applets, servlets, etc.), JSP (JavaServer Pages technology), IIS (Internet Information Services) or other HTTP or web application server such as Apache Tomcat, Glassfish, etc., knowledge of various website frameworks and development environments such as Visual Studio, Eclipse and .NET; Knowledge of cloud technologies such as AWS Lambda and Serverless Computing.

raw_data.vendor_name: PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY SERVICES, INC
raw_data.title: Network Admin
raw_data.description: Knowledgeable of networking infrastructure and boundary protection equipment, associated cryptographic equipment, configurations, upgrades, installation, testing and troubleshooting of networking equipment in classified and unclassified DoD and Air Force enterprise environments.

raw_data.vendor_name: PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY SERVICES, INC
raw_data.title: AWS Architect
raw_data.description: Leads and directs all aspects of the AWS environment buildout.

raw_data.vendor_name: PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY SERVICES, INC
raw_data.title: Trainer
raw_data.description: Proficient computer skills, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Excel), and instructional software. Experience with technologies and best practices for instructional manuals and teaching platforms.

raw_data.vendor_name: PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY SERVICES, INC
raw_data.title: Database Analyst
raw_data.description: Knowledgeable in Windows Server 2008R - 2016; SQL Server 2008R - 2014; Oracle 11g or higher RDBMS experience; and BMC Remedy Action Request System v7x platform.  Implements, maintains, and designs databases in support of the development and installation of new systems and enhancements to existing systems, Performs system administration and system management functions for database systems.

raw_data.vendor_name: PROGRAM MANAGEMENT AND TECHNOLOGY SERVICES, INC
raw_data.title: Senior Programmer
raw_data.description: Develops, maintains, and enhances complex and diverse software systems (e.g. processing-intensive analytics, novel algorithm development, manipulation of extremely large data sets, real-time systems, and business management information systems) based upon documented requirements. Works individually or as part of a team. Reviews and tests software components for adherence to the design requirements and documents test results. Resolves software problem reports. Utilizes software development and software design methodologies appropriate to the development environment. Provides specific input to the software components of system design to include hardware/software tradeoffs, software reuse, and use of Commercial Off-the-shelf (COTS) in place of new development, and requirements analysis and synthesis from system level to individual software components.
